721365f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 50th Street
721365f-a.text:
Pifth Avenue, east side, from East 50th to 51st Street.
This view shows the 51st Street side of the R. C. Cath-
edral of St. Patrick prior to the addition of the twin
steeples (1888). The Archbishopric is on the left and
fronts on Madison Avenue. This was proposed for a Fifth
Avenue frontage by Archbishop Hughs. The property decided
upon was thru picue purchased by an infamous abortionist
''Madame Restell''.
1888
Thru the New York Historical Society
MAY BE REPRODUCED

721359f-a.title: Manhattan: Madison Avenue - 50th Street
721359f-a.text:
Madison AVenue, east sice looking north from 50th Street.
On east side between 5Oth and 5lst Street is the double house built
by the late Whitelaw Reio. On N.E. corner of 5lst Street is the
fomer residence of Mrs. Oliver H.P. Belmont, built about 1899.
Next to the north is new Columbia Broadcasting building, on S.E.
corner of 52nd Street.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  Vieog tt G.~ ;
